meanings.definition: To strike the palms of the hands together with a sudden explosive sound
meanings.sent1: The children clap happily at the end of the show.
meanings.sent2: She likes to clap along with the music.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys clap in the jungle, imitating the humans.
meanings.sent4: The waves clap against the shore in a rhythmic dance.
meanings.sent5: The audience clap enthusiastically, showing their appreciation.

meanings.definition: A sudden, explosive sound made by striking the palms of the hands together
meanings.sent1: The loud clap of thunder startled the dog.
meanings.sent2: I heard a clap coming from the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The clap of hands echoed through the empty hall.
meanings.sent4: The sudden clap of the door closing made me jump.
meanings.sent5: The clap of applause filled the room with energy.

meanings.definition: To applaud by clapping the hands
meanings.sent1: The audience will clap for the talented performers.
meanings.sent2: People clap to show their support and appreciation.
meanings.sent3: I clap loudly for my friend's success.
meanings.sent4: She will clap for her favorite team at the game.
meanings.sent5: Let's clap together to cheer them on!

meanings.definition: A sudden, sharp noise, as of thunder or a door slamming
meanings.sent1: The clap of the door closing made me jump.
meanings.sent2: The sudden clap of thunder scared the cat.
meanings.sent3: The loud clap of the book hitting the floor surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: A single clap of thunder broke the silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The clap of the window shutting woke me up.
